title: MyMachine – from Kindergarten to Industry introducing a Creative Approach to all levels in Education

author: Mihajela Črnko, CT3 Centre for Knowledge Transfer in Information Technologies, Jožef Stefan Institute
Piet Grymonprez, Mymachine Global

segmentation: Imagine you're a 6 year old child again, and you're drawing pictures of the world around you.
I bet that sooner or later you'll start making drawings of machines just as millions of other children have done before.
Now ask yourself this question was a machine you invented ever built?
More likely your drawing was put on a wall of fame or in a scrapbook.
Imagine that your invention really gets built.
First, it is turned into a concept by engineers and then skilled people construct it into a real machine, aureille working, humming useful machine that does exactly what you wanted it to do.
You, as a child inventor are involved in every phase from concepts to the manufacturing and selling and shipping.
Now, wouldn't that be a wonderful way to learn and share?
This is what my machine is about.
My machine is a foundation acting worldwide with one goal.
Turning brilliant ideas into tangible dream machines.
My machine involves children in primary schools, engineering and product designer, students, pupils in technical high schools, an marketing students.
Smart adults say that my machine stimulates creativity in education and innovation and entrepreneurship.
We children simply know that my machine means serious play.

First, it is turned into a concept by engineers and then skilled people construct it into a real machine, aureille working, humming useful machine that does exactly what you wanted it to do.
You, as a child inventor are involved in every phase from concepts to the manufacturing and selling and shipping.
Now, wouldn't that be a wonderful way to learn and share?

We children simply know that my machine means serious play.
